definition: selfless/impartial
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
personal/private/selfish

sentences.english: A fair game depends on an unbiased referee.
sentences.chinese: 一場公平的賽事取決於一位大公無私的球證。

sentences.english: I deem that a king conforming to Tao should be selfless.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲合於道的君王應該是大公無私的。

sentences.english: It is impossible for me to be impartial.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能做到大公無私。

sentences.english: But members of the league could also have less altruistic motives.
sentences.chinese: 但是，阿盟各成員國的動機也談不上大公無私。

sentences.english: Such is Shen Hao, a diligent, warm­hearted and selfless man.
sentences.chinese: 這就是沈浩，一個勤奮，熱心而又大公無私的人。

sentences.english: They discussed how to emulate the selfless spirit of these comrades.
sentences.chinese: 他們討論如何學習這些同志大公無私的精神。

sentences.english: Everyone has to bow before the selfless time.
sentences.chinese: 在大公無私的時間前面，誰也不能不低頭認輸。

sentences.english: Her unselfish act reflects well on her upbringing.
sentences.chinese: 她的大公無私行爲充分體現出她受過良好的教養。

sentences.english: It is the working class that is most selfless.
Although nowadays people in mounting numbers talk about the need to be unselfish.
sentences.chinese: 儘管現在越來越多的人談論到大公無私的必要性。

sentences.english: Aunt Estelle's unselfishness was her greatest gift.
sentences.chinese: 埃斯特爾姨媽的大公無私是她最好的禮物。

sentences.english: It was an excellent lesson in fairness and sticking to your guns.
sentences.chinese: 就大公無私以及堅持立場而言，這是絕妙的一課。

definition: to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to be strict with oneself
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to be chivalrous
magnanimous (idiom); generous
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
kind and charitable
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
to follow through/to carry through to the end
to regard it as an honor (idiom)
strictly impartial and incorruptible (idiom)
